hanzi-su-wiki:
葉

Значения

Листья, листва

Мнемоника

  • Зелёные, как трава 艹, листья. На деревьях 木 они сменяются поколение за поколением 世.

  • Мир 世 покрыт травой и листьями деревьев 木.

Варианты

叶

heisig_chinese_memo: On top of the leafs a flower appears, promising new generations for the old tree below.
heisig_constituent: leaf, flowers, Tarzan, generation, tree, wood
heisig_story: Three elements are given here: flower . . . generation . . . tree. The first and last seem logical enough, since it is the leaf that feeds the flowers on a tree. The element for generation interposed between the two suggests that the movement of a tree from one generation to the next is like its "turning over a new leaf."
Keyword_KANJIDIC: leaf, plane, lobe, needle, blade, spear, counter for flat things, fragment, piece
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: лист, самолет, лопасть, игла, лезвие, копье, счетчик для плоских вещей, фрагмент, шт
koohiiStory1: On top of the leaves a flower appears, promising new generations for the old tree below.
koohiiStory2: The flower generation spent far too much time up trees trying to smoke leaves.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: In the world of flowers and trees, the most important thing is the leaf. Leaves are how flowers and trees get their nutrients from the sun!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Leaves, no matter how little, are the most important thing in the world for them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Picture a little flower working really hard to grow its first leaf. The leaf pops out and it shouts, "Ha (は)!"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: は is the sound of a leaf coming into existence. Whenever you see a plant from now on, hear the little ha sound it makes when each leaf pops out of its body.
Ru_Meaning: leaf, plane, lobe, needle, blade, spear, counter for flat things, fragment, piece

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the grass (艹) in the tree world (枼) is the leaves
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: China is famous for herbal medicine.  Here a doctor is trying to stuff TEN types of leaf into your MOUTH at once.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from "艸", "枼" sound. The original text of " Ye " is "枼", the original meaning is leaves, see "枼". "Shuowen": "Ye, the leaves of the wood. From the dog to the sound." Handed down documents are mostly used as the original meaning, referring to leaves, "Poems. Xiaoya. Vetch Flower": "Its leaves are Qingqing." "Chu Ci. Nine songs. "Mrs. Xiang": "Dongting is under the trees."

Bronze writing is used as the name of the person, and the prime minister touches the Ge: "The prime minister touches the creation, the Xiangongshi (teacher) leaf."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to represent leaves, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Legal Questions and Answers" line 7: "mulberry leaf". Han silk script is also used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui silk script. Fifty-two prescriptions for diseases, line 166: "The leaves of pansy are small and the stems are red." The word is also used as the place name, "Mawangdui Silk Book. Warring States Political Strategist Book. The 158th line of "Zhu Ji Wei Wang Zhang": "Qin Youye, Kunyang, Bing" is next to Wuyang." " Ye ", "Kunyang" and "Wuyang" are all place names. Kunyang is in the south of Yexian County, Henan Province, during the Warring States Period The leaf land was in the south of Kunyang. As for Wuyang at that time, it belonged to the Wei state, and the land was in the west of Wuyang County, Henan Province. "Zuo Zhuan. "Fifteen Years of Cheng Gong": "Master Chu Shen Qian Xu Yuye."

" Ye " is used as the surname in the Han Dynasty, "Fun Su Tong": "Chu Shen Yin was born in Zhuliang, eating from the leaves, because of the family Yan."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from "艸", "枼". The original text of " Ye " is "枼", the original meaning is leaves, see "枼".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「艸」，「枼」聲。「葉」的初文是「枼」，本義是樹葉，參見「枼」。《說文》：「葉，艸木之葉也。从艸，枼聲。」傳世文獻多用作本義，指樹葉，《詩．小雅．苕之華》：「其葉青青。」《楚辭．九歌．湘夫人》：「洞庭波兮木葉下。」



　　金文用作人名，丞相觸戈：「丞相觸造，咸工帀(師)葉。」



　　戰國竹簡用作本義，表示樹葉，《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》第7行：「桑葉」。漢帛書亦用作本義，《馬王堆帛書．五十二病方》第166行：「堇葉異小，赤莖。」字又用作地名，《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書．朱己謂魏王章》第158行：「秦有葉、昆陽，兵〈與〉舞陽鄰。」「葉」、「昆陽」、「舞陽」均為地名，昆陽在今河南省葉縣南，戰國時期的葉地在昆陽南方，至於舞陽當時屬魏國，地在今河南省舞陽縣西。《左傳．成公十五年》：「楚公子申遷許于葉。」



　　漢印中「葉」用作姓氏，《風俗通》：「楚沈尹戍生諸梁，食采於葉，因氏焉。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「艸」，「枼」聲。「葉」的初文是「枼」，本義是樹葉，參見「枼」。

①植物的營養器官之一：樹葉。菜葉。葉子。葉落歸根。一葉知秋。一葉蔽目(喻目光短淺，常被眼前細小事物所遮蔽，看不到遠處、大處。亦稱“一葉障目”)。
②像葉子的：鐵葉。百葉窗。
③同“頁”。
④世，時期：初葉。末葉。
⑤姓氏。

金文從「 艸 」，「 枼 」聲。「 葉 」的初文是「 枼 」，本義是樹葉，參見「 枼 」。《說文》：「葉，艸木之葉也。从艸，枼聲。」傳世文獻多用作本義，指樹葉，《詩．小雅．苕之華》：「其葉青青。」《楚辭．九歌．湘夫人》：「洞庭波兮木葉下。」 金文用作人名，丞相觸戈：「丞相觸造，咸工帀(師)葉。」 戰國竹簡用作本義，表示樹葉，《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》第7行：「桑葉」。漢帛書亦用作本義，《馬王堆帛書．五十二病方》第166行：「堇葉異小，赤莖。」字又用作地名，《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書．朱己謂魏王章》第158行：「秦有葉、昆陽，兵〈與〉舞陽鄰。」「 葉 」、「昆陽」、「舞陽」均為地名，昆陽在今河南省葉縣南，戰國時期的葉地在昆陽南方，至於舞陽當時屬魏國，地在今河南省舞陽縣西。《左傳．成公十五年》：「楚公子申遷許于葉。」 漢印中「 葉 」用作姓氏，《風俗通》：「楚沈尹戍生諸梁，食采於葉，因氏焉。」
Bronze inscription from " 艸", " 枼" sound. The original text of " Ye" is " 枼", the original meaning is leaves, see " 枼". "Shuowen": "Ye, the leaves of the wood. From the dog to the sound." Handed down documents are mostly used as the original meaning, referring to leaves, "Poems. Xiaoya. Vetch Flower": "Its leaves are Qingqing." "Chu Ci. Nine songs. "Mrs. Xiang": "Dongting is under the trees." Bronze writing is used as the name of the person, and the prime minister touches the Ge: "The prime minister touches the creation, the Xiangongshi (teacher) leaf." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to represent leaves, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Legal Questions and Answers" line 7: "mulberry leaf". Han silk script is also used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui silk script. Fifty-two prescriptions for diseases, line 166: "The leaves of pansy are small and the stems are red." The word is also used as the place name, "Mawangdui Silk Book. Warring States Political Strategist Book. The 158th line of "Zhu Ji Wei Wang Zhang": "Qin Youye, Kunyang, Bing" is next to Wuyang." " Ye", "Kunyang" and "Wuyang" are all place names. Kunyang is in the south of Yexian County, Henan Province, during the Warring States Period The leaf land was in the south of Kunyang. As for Wuyang at that time, it belonged to the Wei state, and the land was in the west of Wuyang County, Henan Province. "Zuo Zhuan. "Fifteen Years of Cheng Gong": "Master Chu Shen Qian Xu Yuye." " Ye" is used as the surname in the Han Dynasty, "Fun Su Tong": "Chu Shen Yin was born in Zhuliang, eating from the leaves, because of the family Yan."

葉字的基本解释

葉
yè
见“叶1”。

葉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yè］
［《廣韻》與涉切，入葉，以。］
“叶2”的繁体字。
(1)植物营养器官之一。斜生于枝茎之上，以司同化、呼吸、蒸发等作用。一般分为叶片、叶柄、托叶三部分。
(2)指花瓣。
(3)特指桑叶。
(4)衣幅。
(5)像叶子那样轻薄的东西。
(6)书页。
(7)世。代。
(8)世。时期。
(9)量词。轻薄物体的计量单位。
[②]［shè］［yè］
［《廣韻》書涉切，入葉，書。］
“叶3”的繁体字。
(1)古邑名。在今河南省叶县南。春秋时属楚领地。汉置县。
(2)姓。春秋楚有叶公诸梁。见《左传·定公五年》。

葉字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　葉； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1044第03
【唐韻】與涉切【集韻】【正韻】弋涉切，?音枼。【說文】草木之葉。【陸游詩註】吳人直謂桑曰葉。　又世也。【詩·商頌】昔在中葉，有震且業。　又【博雅】聚也。　又書冊。【歐陽修曰】唐人藏書皆作卷軸，後有葉子，似今策子。　又姓。【通志·氏族略】葉氏，舊音攝，後世與木葉同音。　又與䔾通。【儀禮·士冠禮】贊者洗於房中，側酌醴，加柶，覆之面葉。【註】古文葉爲䔾。　又式涉切，音攝。【左傳·及葉註】葉，今南陽葉縣。　又【韻補】叶，逆約切，音虐。【易林】桑芳將落，隕其黃葉。　又叶於急切。【易林】同本異葉，樂人上德。東鄰慕義，來興吾國。　又【集韻】徒協切，音牒。與䈎同，書篇名。　【韻會】或作?，非。

暂无。

leaf
Basic explanation of words
leaf
yè
See "Leaf 1".
leaf
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yè］
["Guang Yun" and She cut, enter the leaves, to. ]
Traditional characters for "叶2".
(1) One of the plant vegetative organs. Born obliquely on the branches and stems, with the effects of assimilation, respiration, and evaporation. It is generally divided into three parts: leaf blade, petiole and stipule.
(2) Refers to petals.
(3) Especially refers to mulberry leaves.
(4) Clothing width.
(5) Something as light and light as a leaf.
(6) Book pages.
(7) World. generation.
(8) World. period.
(9) Quantifiers. The unit of measurement for thin and light objects.
[②]［shè］［yè］
["Guangyun" book involves cutting, entering leaves, book. ]
Traditional characters for "叶3".
(1) The name of the ancient town. In the south of Yexian County, Henan Province today. It belonged to Chu territory in the Spring and Autumn Period. Hanzhi County.
(2) Last name. There are Ye Gongzhu Liang in the Spring and Autumn Period. See "Zuo Zhuan·Ding Gong Five Years".

yè
вм. 叶

葉

Значения

Листья, листва

Мнемоника

  • Зелёные, как трава 艹, листья. На деревьях 木 они сменяются поколение за поколением 世.

  • Мир 世 покрыт травой и листьями деревьев 木.

Варианты

叶

Radicals: 艹, 世, 木  (flowers, world, tree)
Meaning Mnemonic
In the world of flowers and trees, the most important thing is the leaf. Leaves are how flowers and trees get their nutrients from the sun!
Leaves, no matter how little, are the most important thing in the world for them.
Reading Mnemonic
Picture a little flower working really hard to grow its first leaf. The leaf pops out and it shouts, "Ha (は)!"
は is the sound of a leaf coming into existence. Whenever you see a plant from now on, hear the little ha sound it makes when each leaf pops out of its body.
